intro: Verbascum bracteosum, commonly known as the bracteate mullein, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa. It belongs to the family Scrophulariaceae and is characterized by its tall, hairy stems and large, showy yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and thrives in sunny environments. Its leaves are broad and gray-green, covered in fine hairs that help reduce water loss. Verbascum bracteosum is often found in meadows, grasslands, and along roadsides, where it contributes to local biodiversity.
